I hereby transfer to you the property listed in the schedule below, registered in my name as Door No. 3-444, Old Assessment No. 538, New Assessment No. XXXX XXXX XXXX, having a market value of Rs. 6,21,000/- in characters, free of charge and transfer the said property to you today itself. From today onwards, you shall pay all the Panchayat taxes, etc. due on the property as per the schedule, and donate it as per your wish. If you enjoy the rights of possession, exchange, sale, and all, you, your heirs, I, and my heirs will never have any disputes, quarrels, or court cases. I hereby give you this settlement deed as an undisputed property free from any encumbrances or encumbrances, and I hereby certify that this property has not been encroached upon or encumbered by any other person. If any disputes, quarrels, or court cases arise in connection with this settlement property, I will settle them all at my own expense and this small amount of money will be paid by you. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement deed No 483 of 2026 dated 29/Jan/2026, executed by Ramavath Chinna Kasinya Naik In favour of his wife Ramavath Vijaya, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 128.5Sq.Yds, bearing house number 3-444, old assessment number 538, new assessment number 200366000538, comprised in survey number 386K situated in, Latchammabavi Gram Panchayath, Koppunuru H/O, Achammakunta village, Macherla Mandal, within the District of Palnadu, within Narsaraopet Head Quarter, registered at sub-registrar office Macherla725) is bounded as follows: North by: House frontage of Ramavath Chinna Naik – 56 feet 0 inches South by: House frontage of Ramavath Bujji – 56 feet 0 inches East by: Bazaar – 20 feet 8 inches West by: Site of Ramavath Bujji – 20 feet 8 inches
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
